trans-unit.source: Thank you for your interest in updating a topic using our new [GitHub] (https://help.github.com/) and [Markdown] (https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/), open docs system.
trans-unit.target: Thank you for your interest in updating a topic using our new [GitHub] (https://help.github.com/) and [Markdown] (https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/), open docs system.

trans-unit.source: This is a pilot process, where we can work with others to co-author MSDN content using open doc tools.
trans-unit.target: This is a pilot process, where we can work with others to co-author MSDN content using open doc tools.

trans-unit.source: Setting up your GitHub Account
trans-unit.target: Setting up your GitHub Account

trans-unit.source: If you don't have a Microsoft associated GitHub ID, you will need to create a GitHub account, here are the directions to do that.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have a Microsoft associated GitHub ID, you will need to create a GitHub account, here are the directions to do that.

trans-unit.source: First step is to get a github login:
trans-unit.target: First step is to get a github login:

trans-unit.source: [https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-get-a-github-id] (https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-get-a-github-id)
trans-unit.target: [https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-get-a-github-id] (https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-get-a-github-id)

trans-unit.source: Then you need to associate that GitHub account as Microsoft account:
trans-unit.target: Then you need to associate that GitHub account as Microsoft account:

trans-unit.source: [https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service] (https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service)
trans-unit.target: [https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service] (https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service)

trans-unit.source: When that is done, you can email the docs team contact your GitHub account and we will grant permissions for it to the driver docs pilot project.
trans-unit.target: When that is done, you can email the docs team contact your GitHub account and we will grant permissions for it to the driver docs pilot project.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Proper Branch
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Proper Branch

trans-unit.source: After permissions are granted, you can make changes in the “vnext” branch using a browser.
trans-unit.target: After permissions are granted, you can make changes in the “vnext” branch using a browser.

trans-unit.source: Contact the docs team for a link to the topic you will be working on.
trans-unit.target: Contact the docs team for a link to the topic you will be working on.

trans-unit.source: The example driver signing topic shown in the screen shots, is a live topic, so please refrain from experimenting with it.
trans-unit.target: The example driver signing topic shown in the screen shots, is a live topic, so please refrain from experimenting with it.

trans-unit.source: [https://github.com/Microsoft/windows-driver-docs-private/blob/vnext/develop/] (https://github.com/Microsoft/windows-driver-docs-private/blob/vnext/develop/)
trans-unit.target: [https://github.com/Microsoft/windows-driver-docs-private/blob/vnext/develop/] (https://github.com/Microsoft/windows-driver-docs-private/blob/vnext/develop/)

trans-unit.source: Making Edits
trans-unit.target: Making Edits

trans-unit.source: Click on the pencil to edit the topic:
trans-unit.target: Click on the pencil to edit the topic:

trans-unit.source: Diagram 1
trans-unit.target: Diagram 1

trans-unit.source: You can make edits in the browser based editor.
trans-unit.target: You can make edits in the browser based editor.

trans-unit.source: For fancy formatting such as bullets, markdown is used.
trans-unit.target: For fancy formatting such as bullets, markdown is used.

trans-unit.source: Here is one link that describes the available formatting: [https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/] (https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/)
trans-unit.target: Here is one link that describes the available formatting: [https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/] (https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/)

trans-unit.source: Committing the Changes
trans-unit.target: Committing the Changes

trans-unit.source: When you are done, click on the commit changes button at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: When you are done, click on the commit changes button at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: ![Diagram 2] (images/Browser_Commit_Changes_Screen_Shot.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Diagram 2] (images/Browser_Commit_Changes_Screen_Shot.png)

trans-unit.source: Create a Pull Request
trans-unit.target: Create a Pull Request

trans-unit.source: After the changes are committed, you need to create a pull request to move the changes to the live branch that is published to MSDN.
trans-unit.target: After the changes are committed, you need to create a pull request to move the changes to the live branch that is published to MSDN.

trans-unit.source: To create a pull request:
trans-unit.target: To create a pull request:

trans-unit.source: On the GitHub right sidebar, click the icon for pull requests on the right side of the screen.
trans-unit.target: On the GitHub right sidebar, click the icon for pull requests on the right side of the screen.

trans-unit.source: ![Diagram 3] (images/Browser_Pull_Request_Screen_Shot.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Diagram 3] (images/Browser_Pull_Request_Screen_Shot.png)

trans-unit.source: Then click on the *New pull request* button.
trans-unit.target: Then click on the *New pull request* button.

trans-unit.source: ![Diagram 4] (images/Browser_New_Pull_Request_Screen_Shot.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Diagram 4] (images/Browser_New_Pull_Request_Screen_Shot.png)

trans-unit.source: In the pull down fields select these values.
trans-unit.target: In the pull down fields select these values.

trans-unit.source: base: *vnext*
trans-unit.target: base: *vnext*

trans-unit.source: compare: *master*
trans-unit.target: compare: *master*

trans-unit.source: Click on the *Create pull request* button.
trans-unit.target: Click on the *Create pull request* button.

trans-unit.source: ![Diagram 5] (images/Browser_Comparing_Changes_Screen_Shot.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Diagram 5] (images/Browser_Comparing_Changes_Screen_Shot.png)

trans-unit.source: The docs team will be able to double check the changes that you make and push them live to MSDN.
trans-unit.target: The docs team will be able to double check the changes that you make and push them live to MSDN.
